field.note: Determines whether or not the quiz can be retaken once the user has started the test once.
Choose whether or not to show the "Thank You" page when the quiz is completed.
Warns the user with a popup when they submit the quiz if some questions have invalid or empty answers.
When enabled, User Details and Quiz responses will be logged. These logs will then be available for export from the "Submission Logs" screen.

The number of questions to be drawn from the question pool (see below).
Set to '0' (zero) to draw all the available assets from the question pool.
Assets will only be shown if their status is listed here
Select the root node of a group of question assets to draw from when selecting questions to appear in the quiz. Leave blank to list the sub assets/children of this quiz asset.

Defines how assets are managed when there is more than one root node displayed (either selected above, or through a replacement root node setting). If there is only one root node selected, then this option has no effect.
If set to 'Yes', only directly linked assets of the root node will be printed (direct parents or children). Otherwise, all assets above or below the root node will be printed.
Select 'Up the tree' to list assets above the root nodes, or 'Down the tree' to list assets below.

This optional setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned off. If a number is entered here, assets must be at least this number of levels below/above a root node to qualify for listing. Immediate children/parents are considered to be at level '1'.

This optional setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned off. If a number is entered here, assets must be no more than this number of levels below/above a root node to qualify for listing. Immediate children/parents are considered to be at level '1'.

This setting only applies when Direct Links Only is turned on. Assets will only be listed if their link to a root node is of one of the link types selected here. The default is to show links visible in the asset map, that is TYPE_1 and TYPE_2 links.
Select where to draw user details (eg. name, email) from. Note that any non-logged in users will be presented with the user details form regardless of this setting.

The format for the results email sent once a quiz has been completed. Leave "To:" blank to disable the sending of the results email.
You may use the following keywords in any of the above fields:
  • %results_table_simple% - A table of results (containing question number, answer & marks)
  • %results_table_full% - A table of results (containing question number, question text, answer, answer text & marks)
  • %user_details_form_[formid]-[questionid]% - the value of the specified form question (eg. '%user_details_form_123-q1%' for question 'q1' belonging to form asset #123)
  • %user_details_current_user_[keyword]% - In the same fashion as the standard %asset_[keyword]%; these keywords are replaced as per the standard keywords, with the exception being that the asset the value is being drawn from is the user taking the test.
    Some example keywords: '%user_details_current_user_name%', '%user_details_current_user_attribute_first_name%', '%user_details_current_user_last_name%' or '%user_details_current_user_email'.

Further detailed Question and Question Group result keywords are available, which can be used instead of the results table keywords. These keywords can be used to manually construct a results table. These keywords are available in the 'Thank You' bodycopy, examples of which are provided below:
  • %question_group_[assetid]_[keyword]% - Result details of a Question Group (keyword: score_category_name, score_category_supplement)
  • %result_[assetid]_[keyword]% - Result details of a Question (keyword: answer_text, response_supplement etc.)
  • %quiz_total_points% - The total points obtained for the Quiz
  • %quiz_total_available_points% - The total points available (ie; maximum score) for the Quiz

Note that a user taking this quiz will either be using their user details OR the form, which means keywords from both can be placed side-by-side with no chance of any ill effects, eg. in the To: field, this is perfectly legitimate: "%user_details_form_123-q1%%user_details_current_user_attribute_email%".

A standard list displays all assets on a single page or can be broken up into multiple pages.
Custom Grouping allows a list based on user specified grouping conditions.

Set to '0' (zero) to list all assets on the same page.
NOTE: This option is only valid when using the standard or custom grouping list formats..
If the listing type is Random, this defines how many assets are randomly displayed ('0' displays a single asset).
Keywords can be used to dynamically set the number of items on the page.
This is the text that will be printed to link to the previous results page
This is the text that will be printed to link to the next results page
Link text to a page containg assets in the A-Z list format which do not begin with A-Z, i.e. numbers or other characters
This is the format of a linked page number in pagination. Available keywords are %page_link%, %page_number%
This is the format of current page number in pagination. Available keyword is %page_number%

If this is set to Yes, an additional "Page Contents (No Results)" bodycopy will appear, allowing you to specify different contents when there are no assets to list. Note that this is turned on by default.
